data_findings.finding: This is a 2D packing optimization problem: fit N Christmas tree toys (N=1-200) into smallest square bounding box. Score = sum of (side^2 / N) for all N. Lower is better. Target: beat 68.931058.
Key tool: bbox3 binary optimizer - runs with parameters -n (iterations) and -r (restarts). Used by top kernels. Example: ./bbox3 -n 2000 -r 96

fix_direction function: Optimizes rotation of entire configuration to minimize bounding box. Uses scipy.optimize.minimize_scalar to find optimal rotation angle (0-90 degrees). Critical post-processing step.

Santa Claude kernel uses C++ tree_packer with OpenMP parallelization. Features: simulated annealing, local search, squeeze/compaction, swap moves, multi-start optimization. Also uses backward_propagation to improve smaller N configs from larger ones.
Overlap repair strategy: If optimization creates overlaps, replace those N configurations with known-good baseline configurations from a donor file.
